arm_group.description:
Centralised or Decentralised  rehabilitation
Size of municipality

brief_summary.textblock:
Return to work following severe traumatic brain injury (TBI) has been investigated by a
      number of studies, revealing a wide range of RTW-proportions and ambiguous prognostic
      factors. This ambiguity may be due to complex interaction between many factors, including
      rehabilitation services.

      In Denmark rehabilitation services partly depend on the residence of the individual with
      TBI.

      In the current study, return to work and quality of life following severe TBI is
      investigated using danish register data and a questionnaire.

      The first purpose of the study is to investigate a possible link between centralized
      rehabilitation and better return to work / quality of life.

      The second purpose is to investigate if the size of the municipality, which was affected by
      a major structural reform in 2007, is of importance for quality of life and when attempting
      to return to work after severe TBI.

      The study population will be identified from the Danish Head Trauma Database. The
      completeness and accuracy of the database will be investigated as the first part of the
      project.

clinical_study.brief_title: Return to Work and QOL Following TBI. Impact of Rehabilitation Service.

study_pop.textblock: Individuals suffering from severe TBI (GCS<9) from the Danish Head Trauma Database

intervention.description:
Centralised/ decentralised hospitalbased rehabilitation defined as hospitalbased rehabilitation in a single or in multiple locations, respectively.
Size of the municipality responsible for providing rehabilitationservices after discharge from hospital

clinical_study.official_title: Return to Work and QOL Following TBI. Impact of Rehabilitation Service.

overall_official.affiliation: Research Unit (Forskningsenheden), Hammel Neurorehabilitation and Research Centre

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Retrospective
